1923 A small collection of materials relating to Brooklyn middle school P.S. 64 in East New York. These materials were compiled by Bella Gordon, a student in the class of 1923.
Biographical Note
Bella Gordon was born in 1909 and attended P.S. 64 in East New York, Brooklyn, where she completed middle school in 1923.
Scope and Contents
The collection consists of two black and white photographs mounted on board, a leatherbound autograph book, and a postcard.
Access
Collection is located in the Brooklyn Collection at the Central Branch at Grand Army Plaza. The collection may only be used in the library and is not available through interlibrary loan. Requests to view the collection must be made at least 48 hours in advance of visit.
Use
While many items in the Brooklyn Collection are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
Provenance
Donated by Nancy Kossar, daughter of Bella Gordon, in 2018.
Arrangement
The four items in this collection are stored in one box.
